SideNav.title: チュートリアル
SideNav.tooltip: Tour of Heroesチュートリアルでは、TypeScriptでAngularアプリケーションを作成する手順を説明します

children.title: 1. Introduction
children.tooltip: Part 1: Introduction to the Tour of Heroes tutorial

children.title: 2. The Application Shell
children.tooltip: Part 2: Creating the application shell

children.title: 3. The Hero Editor
children.tooltip: Part 3: Build a simple hero editor

children.title: 4. Displaying a List
children.tooltip: Part 4: Build a master/detail page with a list of heroes.

children.title: 5. Master/Detail Components
children.tooltip: Part 5: Refactor the master/detail view into separate components.

children.title: 6. Services
children.tooltip: Part 6: Create a reusable service to manage hero data.

children.title: 7. Routing
children.tooltip: Part 7: Add the Angular router and navigate among the views.

children.title: 8. HTTP
children.tooltip: Part 8: Use HTTP to retrieve and save hero data.

children.title: Architecture
children.tooltip: The basic building blocks of Angular applications.

children.title: Template & Data Binding
children.tooltip: Template & Data Binding

children.title: Displaying Data
children.tooltip: Property binding helps show app data in the UI.

children.title: Template Syntax
children.tooltip: Learn how to write templates that display data and consume user events with the help of data binding.

children.title: Lifecycle Hooks
children.tooltip: Angular calls lifecycle hook methods on directives and components as it creates, changes, and destroys them.

children.title: Component Interaction
children.tooltip: Share information between different directives and components.

children.title: Component Styles
children.tooltip: Add CSS styles that are specific to a component.

children.title: Dynamic Components
children.tooltip: Load components dynamically.

children.title: Attribute Directives
children.tooltip: Attribute directives attach behavior to elements.

children.title: Structural Directives
children.tooltip: Structural directives manipulate the layout of the page.

children.title: Pipes
children.tooltip: Pipes transform displayed values within a template.

children.title: Animations
children.tooltip: A guide to Angular's animation system.

children.title: Forms
children.tooltip: Angular Forms

children.title: User Input
children.tooltip: User input triggers DOM events. We listen to those events with event bindings that funnel updated values back into our components and models.

children.title: Template-driven Forms
children.tooltip: A form creates a cohesive, effective, and compelling data entry experience. An Angular form coordinates a set of data-bound user controls, tracks changes, validates input, and presents errors.

children.title: Form Validation
children.tooltip: Validate user's form entries.

children.title: Reactive Forms
children.tooltip: Create a reactive form using FormBuilder, groups, and arrays.

children.title: Dynamic forms
children.tooltip: Render dynamic forms with FormGroup.

children.title: Bootstrapping
children.tooltip: Tell Angular how to construct and bootstrap the app in the root "AppModule".

children.title: NgModules
children.tooltip: Learn how to use NgModules to make your apps efficient.

children.title: NgModules
children.tooltip: Define application modules with @NgModule.

children.title: NgModule FAQs
children.tooltip: Answers to frequently asked questions about @NgModule.

children.title: Dependency Injection
children.tooltip: Dependency Injection: creating and injecting services

children.title: Dependency Injection
children.tooltip: Angular's dependency injection system creates and delivers dependent services "just-in-time".

children.title: Hierarchical Injectors
children.tooltip: Angular's hierarchical dependency injection system supports nested injectors in parallel with the component tree.

children.title: DI in Action
children.tooltip: Techniques for Dependency Injection.

children.title: HttpClient
children.tooltip: Use HTTP to talk to a remote server.

children.title: Routing & Navigation
children.tooltip: Discover the basics of screen navigation with the Angular Router.

children.title: Testing
children.tooltip: Techniques and practices for testing an Angular app.

children.title: Cheat Sheet
children.tooltip: A quick guide to common Angular coding techniques.
